title: Balkan states 'ready to close borders if need be'
text:
Sofia - Bulgaria, Romania and Serbia pledged on Saturday to seek a Europe-wide solution to the migrant crisis, but warned they would close their borders if other EU countries stopped taking new arrivals.
Bulgarian Prime Minister Boyko Borisov said the three countries were not prepared to become a "buffer zone" for the thousands of people trying to reach the European Union (EU), many fleeing war in Syria and Afghanistan.
The EU is holding a mini-summit in Brussels on Sunday to try to work out a cross-border approach to the worst migrant crisis in Europe since WWII, which has seen 670 000 people land this year.
The influx has prompted EU member Hungary to close its borders with Serbia and Croatia to halt the flow of new arrivals and Slovenia has threatened to do likewise.
